description: Custom demo dataset for Text-to-SQL evaluation with sample e-commerce queries

questions.question: Show me all users
questions.sql: SELECT id, name, country FROM users LIMIT 200;

questions.question: Top 5 skus by revenue
questions.sql: SELECT sku, SUM(price) as revenue FROM items GROUP BY sku ORDER BY revenue DESC LIMIT 5;

questions.question: Orders over 100 dollars
questions.sql: SELECT id, user_id, total FROM orders WHERE total > 100 ORDER BY total DESC LIMIT 200;

questions.question: Users from the US
questions.sql: SELECT id, name, country FROM users WHERE country = 'US' LIMIT 200;

questions.question: Total revenue by country
questions.sql: SELECT u.country, SUM(o.total) as revenue FROM orders o JOIN users u ON o.user_id = u.id GROUP BY u.country ORDER BY revenue DESC LIMIT 200;

questions.question: Average order value by user
questions.sql: SELECT u.name, AVG(o.total) as avg_order_value FROM orders o JOIN users u ON o.user_id = u.id GROUP BY u.id, u.name ORDER BY avg_order_value DESC LIMIT 200;

questions.question: Count of orders per user
questions.sql: SELECT u.name, COUNT(o.id) as order_count FROM users u LEFT JOIN orders o ON u.id = o.user_id GROUP BY u.id, u.name ORDER BY order_count DESC LIMIT 200;

questions.question: Users who have no orders
questions.sql: SELECT u.id, u.name FROM users u LEFT JOIN orders o ON u.id = o.user_id WHERE o.id IS NULL LIMIT 200;

questions.question: Most expensive item in each order
questions.sql: SELECT i.order_id, MAX(i.price) as max_price FROM items i GROUP BY i.order_id ORDER BY max_price DESC LIMIT 200;

questions.question: Total revenue for orders created in 2025
questions.sql: SELECT SUM(total) as total_revenue FROM orders WHERE created_at LIKE '2025%' LIMIT 200;
